result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle A Orzewalla was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Restitution in the amount of $223.00 to Robin S.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $223.00 
Pay DNA surcharges;
All applicable fees of supervision.
Cash Bail to apply.

No further violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No violent contact with victim and his family.
No possession of  illegal drugs.

Cooperate with the Probation Department.
Provide a DNA sample.
AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  
Sentencing proceeded.   Statements made as to sentencing.   
Defendant has paid $1000.00 of restitution.  Parties stipulate to $223.00 additional restitution to Robin S.
Court ordered defendant to serve 5 months in the House of Correction straight time, with 6 days credit.  Court stayed the sentence and placed the defendant on 1 year probation
  Conditions of Probation:
- No further violations rising to the level of probable cause
- No violent contact with victim and his family
- Cooperate with the Probation Department
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary
- 25 hours of community service
- No possession of  illegal drugs
- Seek and maintain full-time employment
- Provide a DNA sample.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $223.00 
Pay DNA surcharges;
All applicable fees of supervision.
Cash Bail to apply

Filed:  
Victim Impact Statement
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Kyle A Orzewalla in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for Ron Dague for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  On oral amendment by the State Court ordered charge amended to Battery, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1) , a Class A to which the defendent pled not guilty.

Defendant Kyle A Orzewalla in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for Ron Dague for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk    Money has been placed in a trust account.  Court grants defense request for adjournment. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 19.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kyle A Orzewalla in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.    All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kyle A Orzewalla in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Paul Hauer for Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 05-20-2015 at 01:30 pm.
